error.crash: Something went wrong, please try refresh :)

mobileNotSupported.1: Mobile devices are not supported yet :)
mobileNotSupported.2: Please open it on your computer

syntax.E22: Invalid chord, at least two notes in `[]`
syntax.E31: Invalid length, at least two length part in `()`
syntax.E34: Invalid length, `.` or `..` can't be put after `-` or `__`

hint.start: Click or press space to start
hint.resume: Click or press space to resume

help.s1: is a web app where you to play piano with a computer keyboard. Even people who don't understand music can experience the fun of music here.

list.1: Click or press the space to start playing
list.2: Each letter represents a note, and the rythm (time intervals) is represented by the spacing of the letters
list.3: Press the key corresponding to the highlighted letter to play this note
list.4: Multiple letters underlined represent a chord, all keys need to be pressed at the same time
list.5: Use 'Shift + Letter Key' to press uppercase letters instead of using CapsLock
list.6: If a chord has both lowercase and uppercase letters, you can press and hold the lowercase letter key first, then quickly press the shift key and the uppercase letter key

p1.1: Real world music is complex, if you want to play it with a computer keyboard, some kind of simplification is unavoidable, so it may not be as rich and delicate as the real instrument, but simple music also has simplicity fun of.
p1.2: If you have a `numbered musical notation` for a musical score, you can easily convert it into a format that pianoo can recognize so you can play it.
p1.3: If there are only staves but no numbered notation, then you need to convert it to numbered notation first.
p1.4: You need to first learn `numbered musical notation`, which is a simplified notation of musical notation, and there are many learning resources on the Internet.

list.title: When composing music, you first need the following information, which is usually indicated on your score:
list.1: Score name, e.g. 'City in the Sky'

syntax.title: The content of the score is represented using a specific syntax:
syntax.barline: Barline: | (Barline is only for auxiliary purposes and does not affect the content of the score)

accitental.title: Accitental:
accitental.p: Only sharp and flat are supported, not restore, you need to mark all the notes that need an accitental with # or b

chord.title: Chords:
chord.p: A chord is a number of different notes played at the same time, and their duration is the same. Use [ ] to represent multiple notes, separated by &.

p.1: If an arc is used for the same note, it means that the note is played only once, and the duration is the sum of their respective durations, called a tuplet, represented by ( ), and separated by & as well.
p.2: The duration part of the quarter note is empty, use a ~ symbol in ( )
p.3: If it's different notes, it's a slur, not a tuplet. Slur are not handled, you can just pretend the arc doesn't exist.

p2.1: All notes, rests, and barlines are separated by spaces.
p2.2: Add appropriate line breaks to avoid a single line being too long. Line breaks should be made at appropriate places in the score, usually near rests or notes with longer durations.
p2.3: A piece of music usually has two melodies: a main melody and a sub-melody. For playing with a computer keyboard, only the main melody is usually reserved.
p2.4: If possible, chords should be avoided. Chords increase the difficulty of playing, our goal is not to reproduce the score as much as possible, but to make it playable with a computer keyboard.
p2.5: Some functions such as transposition within the score, grace notes, etc. are not currently supported.

about.title: About
about.p: is a web app where you can play piano (and a few other instruments) with your computer keyboard, easily and breezily. May it brings you some relaxation and fun.
